12 photographic prints : black and white, color ; 8 x 10 in. and smaller.

The collection consists of manuscript materials, sound recordings, photographs, and moving images documenting the performance of Peking Opera, Swiss folk music, Bluegrass music, Bulgarian folk music, Javanese gamelan music and dance, and gospel music recorded live outdoors on Neptune Plaza in front of the Library of Congress.
Archive of Folk Culture (Library of Congress),

seriesstmt.titleproper: Guides to the Collections in the Archive of Folk Culture

did.langmaterial: Bulgarian, Chinese, English, German, and Javanese
did.abstract: The collection consists of manuscript materials, sound recordings, photographs, and moving images documenting the performance of Peking Opera, Swiss folk music, Bluegrass music, Bulgarian folk music, Javanese gamelan music and dance, and gospel music recorded live outdoors on Neptune Plaza in front of the Library of Congress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The 1991 Neptune Plaza Concert Series Collection consists of manuscript and print materials, sound recordings, graphic materials, and moving images that document the 1991 concert series sponsored by the American Folklife Center. The annual series, which began in 1977, features the presentation of folk traditions from many cultures.

The 1991 season consisted of the following:
Date Performers Place of Origin Subject
April 18 Han Sheng Chinese Opera Institute District of Columbia Peking opera
May 16 The Alder Family Switzerland Swiss folk music
June 20 Seldom Scene Virginia Bluegrass music
July 18 Bulgari Bulgaria Bulgarian folk music
August 15 Ensemble of the Embassy of the Republic of Indonesia District of Columbia Javanese gamelan music and dance
September 19 Prophecy: Cops for Christ District of Columbia Gospel music

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Documentation created and accessioned by the American Folklife Center in 1991.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.persname: Supartha, I Gst. Agung Ngurah, dancer.

Han Sheng Chinese Opera Institute, performer.
Prophecy: Cops for Christ (Musical group) performer.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Listening and viewing access to the collection is unrestricted. Duplication of the materials requires prior permission of the Center and may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 1991 Neptune Plaza Concert Series Collection (AFC 1991/012), Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

Two 7" DT mono at 7.5 ips. The recording is poor quality. The Alder Family (5-16-91) is recorded in one direction and the Ensemble of the Embassy of the Republic of Indonesia (8-15-91) is recorded in the opposite direction. As a result, both recordings are barely audible.

scopecontent.p: One 7" DT mono at 3.75 ips. This recording is incomplete. There should have been a second reel for this concert. On AFC 1991/012:SR 4, the Alder Family (5-16-91) is recorded in one direction and the Ensemble of the Embassy of the Republic of Indonesia (8-15-91) is recorded in the opposite direction. As a result, both recordings are barely audible.

One 1/2" VHS videocassette color, sound.

row.entry: Peking Opera (Ching-shi) is an art combining stories, singing, acting, movement, elaborate costumes and make up, and instrumental music. The group performs three scenes from larger operas: "Jade Bracelet," "Heavenly Maiden Scattering Flowers," and "Ch'i Pa and Tang Ma" (wu-styles). Print material and photographs: FOLDERS 2-5; sound recording: AFC 1991/012:SR 1.
Ensemble of the Embassy of the Republic of Indonesia

Javanese gamelan and dance performance. The Ensemble presents the following dances: Gambyong, Javanese classical dance; Satrya, story of a knight; Kuda Kuda, story of horse shepherds; Merak, classical peacock dance from the highlands of West Java; Gambir Anom, dance-drama based on the Maha Bharata epic from Central Java; Jaipongan, popular dance from Sunda West of Jawa Island; and Hanoman-Rahwana, dance-drama based on the tale of Hanoman from the Ramayana epic. Print material and photographs: FOLDERS 17-21; sound recordings: AFC 1991/012:SR 12-13; videotape: AFC 1991/012:V1.
